title: Factoring Semi-Primes: From Basics to RSA
topic_summary: Semi-primes are products of two primes, central to cryptography. Video covers definition, factoring challenges, methods, and RSA application.
target_audience: High school/college students, math enthusiasts, cryptography beginners

scenes.title: What are Semi-Primes?
scenes.narration_summary: Hook with RSA fun fact, define prime and semi-prime, simple examples.

scenes.title: Examples and Properties
scenes.narration_summary: Show small/large semi-primes, properties like even/odd, density.

scenes.title: Basic Factoring: Trial Division
scenes.narration_summary: Demonstrate trial division algorithm, why inefficient for large numbers.

scenes.title: Advanced Methods
scenes.narration_summary: Overview Pollard's rho, Fermat, quadratic sieve; limits of classical computing.

scenes.title: RSA Cryptography
scenes.narration_summary: How RSA uses semi-prime hardness; public/private keys demo.

scenes.title: Recap and Challenges
scenes.narration_summary: Summarize key points, mention quantum threats, call to action.
